reasons_to_visit.details: May offers ideal temperatures (14-22°C) perfect for exploring Hradec Kralove's historic center, university campus, and riverside areas with comfortable conditions.
The university city is in full academic swing with students, cultural events, and vibrant campus life creating an energetic atmosphere throughout the city.
All parks and gardens are in full bloom, especially around the university campus and riverside areas, creating beautiful natural settings for relaxation and photography.
May brings outdoor concerts, university performances, and cultural festivals in the Great Square and historic venues throughout the city.
Perfect weather for enjoying the confluence of the Elbe and Orlice rivers, with riverside cafes, walking paths, and early season boat tours.
Long daylight hours (15+ hours) provide excellent conditions for photographing the city's unique blend of Gothic and modern architecture.
Better value than peak summer months with reasonable accommodation rates and manageable crowds at major attractions.

reasons_to_avoid.details: May marks the beginning of peak tourist season with larger crowds at major attractions like the White Tower and Cathedral of the Holy Spirit.
Accommodation and dining prices begin to rise as peak season approaches, though still better than July-August.
May can bring occasional rain showers and temperature fluctuations that may affect outdoor activity plans.
Late May coincides with university exam periods, which can reduce the typical student atmosphere in certain areas.

activities: Cathedral of the Holy Spirit visits
Spring boat tours on Elbe River
Photography of Gothic and modern architecture
